segments.text: I ’ m tired , Larry . Can we have a break ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What ? You ’ re tired ? But we just started about twenty minutes ago .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know , but I ’ m really tired . My stomach feels funny .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What ’ s the matter ? Didn ’ t you sleep well last night ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I was too excited to sleep last night . I didn ’ t go to sleep until quite late .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Then when did you go to sleep ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: About 2 o ’ clock in the morning .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , Susie . Didn ’ t I tell you over and over again that you wouldn ’ t be able to climb the mountain unless you got enough sleep ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You did , but I can ’ t help it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is a one-day trip . We ’ ll have to keep going and try to reach the top by noon or give up right now and go home . Which one do you choose ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Which one do I choose ? I don ’ t want to give up , but I really feel tired .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So , make up your mind quickly . Whether to keep going or give up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Let me think about it . What should I do ? I think I will not give up .
segments.speaker: S1
